text: Clear amber coloured beer with a small, creme-coloured, medium-lasting head. Aromas of orange peel, floral, grassy, spicy hops, roasted malt, toffee, caramel, bit like fruitcake . Taste is roast malty, bit of the hops, unfortunately not much taste towards finish. High trinkability though. Medium to light body, average carbonation, smooth texture.

Würziger, hell süßlich herber Antrunk. Helles Getreide, milder dumpfer Alkohol. Spritzig, die aufkommende Hopfenherbe unterstützt und verdrängt die muffige Getreidigkeit. Sehr süffig bleibend, steigende Würzigkeit, zum Ende vollmundig, leicht holzig. Gut! 9/11/11/12/9/11
Many thanks for this beer to Erzengel. Pours a yellow colour with an off white head. Caramel nose with some fbready. Malty and sweet flavour.

Many thanks to ThirstyBird for this bottle!  The beer starts malty and slightly grainy. Hints of sweetness and (strangely) alcohol. Easy to drink though, but with a slightly strange malty-grainy sweetish aftertaste. Moderate bitter.

From the bottle, pours a clear golden color with a light tan head. The smell is grass, citrus, toasted grain, bread, mild caramel. The taste is orange peel, toasted malt, bread, fruit ending dry and crisp. The body is Light+ with active carbonation.
Ein feines Piwo, das mit Frucht und etwas Malz spielt. Die Aromen wirken ausbalanciert, gehen in einen leicht süßen Geschmack über, der mit Orangen und Rosinen abschließt. Gefällt mir gut.

Bottle from Dilo in Bochum. The beer has got a clear deep golden-amber colour with an low head and medium body. Aroma of hops and straw. Taste of hops, barley, malt, basement, hay, straw and mild fruits. Easy drinkable and solid beer, yet nothinf special.

(Draught at In De Wildeman, Amsterdam, 21 Aug 2014) Dark golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with slightly toasty malt, apricots and bread. Malty taste with notes of toast, bread, a touch of dried fruit, apricots and a gentle spicy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a certain malt sweetness. Well balanced and tasty. Quite nice.

Tap tasted on 21/08/2014. Clear golden to copper colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is caramel and malts at the first and a bit fruity after. Taste is medium sweet with yeast, bread and cereals. Aftertaste is lightly but nice. Next one please!

Bottle. Beautiful clear copper amber, minimal slightly off-white head, vanishes quickly, thin rim remains, nice lacing; sweet fruity nose, kinda medicinal licorice, hint of honey, apricot, orange, sour cherries, citrus, floral hops; smooth slightly toasted bittersweet taste; medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation; mild bitter finish with sweetsour hints.

Bottle. Golden colour with a white head with medium lasting. Aroma is malty with sweet notes. Flavor has a decent maltiness with notes of marzipan and cookies. Slightly sweet final with a medium duration.

26/IX/13 - 50cl bottle from Biernavigatie (webshop, NL) @ home - BB: 14/XII/13 (2013-896) 
Clear light orange beer, aery white irregular head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: grains, hay, little sweet, orange peel, bit sugary. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: grains, toast, some citrus, bit fruity, bitter, orange peel. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, toast, little sweet, caramel, more bitterness.
500ml Bottle - Golden in colour. Grass, lemon and malt in the aroma. Malty and slightly sweet taste with corn, grain and lemon detected.
Krug at Annafest. Dark amber body with a minimal white head. Malty sweet, then comes the hoppy part. Nothing special...

Pours a coppery liquid with a a head that fades relatively fast. The aroma is amazing. The complexity of malt and some mild fruitness (pears) make this beer a very aromatic one. The taste is also malt dominated but without being too heavy. The bitterness is just enough to make you want another sip. Amazing beer.
Bottle @ In the Wildeman. Pours orange with a bit white head. Notes of honey, citrus and flowery hops. Clean and light malt-profile. Another good beer from St Georgen.
Poured a clear light amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of soft caramel malt. Medium body, flavour of sweet grainy malt and bitter sweet malt with a similar finish.

Bottle @ Pivni Rozmanitost, Prague. Pours clear dark golden with a white head. Malty bready. Cereal. Mild grassy hops and grain. Smooth and dry. I have no doubts about this being greater when fresher.

picked up in the fridge at zly casy. glad to try this annafest having missed out on forchheim again this summer. golden with an unenthusiastic head; vibrant aroma, though, of golden syrup tin and how i imagine the kellerwald; some rusty hop character with hints of breakfast tea. probably a good beer for drinking litre steins of
Like drinking a loaf of bread. Not really, can you liquidise bread. That would be wierd. I guess you cant. Can you? No, scientifically it would miss out the liquid stage. Whats that called?

50cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Hazy golden orange colour, white head. Aroma of sweet malts, wort, bread, light hoppy, a bit fruity. Flavour is medium sweet, juicy malts, light bready, wort, ripe fruits, nice bitter finish. Light bodied, smooth mouthfeel. Could drink a lot of these.

Bottle by 12.02.13.  Nose of very light grass and a squirt of citric hops.  Dull transparent orange body with a short off-white head.  Juicy sweet taste, light-watery body with a deep caramel tones supporting the lighter flights of citrus and malt.  Light bitterness which slowly grows in stature, and some pleasant Dunkel/toast character that comes out toward the end.

In bottle. Pours a golden colour with a white head that dies away after a while. A herbal aroma of wet moss, caramel and yeast. Flavours of caramel, wheat, grassy hops and yeast again. Moderate carbonation and a bitter finish. Very nice with just a little aniseed and Underberg type herbal flavours in the linger.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Golden colour, good head. Corn grain aroma & flavour. Creamy texture slightly harsh metallic aftertaste. Disappointing.

Bottle from Corks, Bristol. Deep gold with a frothy white head and plenty of carbonation. Prominent cereal malt aroma,with a touch of grassy hop. Flavour had plenty more solid malts and some honeyed sweetness, leading to a decent bitter finish. Very good.
Bottled (thanks Timo A.). Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is crisp maltyness, floral and wooden notes. Flavour is floral, nicely bitter hopped, wood, and some pleasant maltyness.

500ml.  Bottle from Bottle Shop Canterbury.  Golden beer.  Lasting white head.  Yes its a lager but soft in mouth great cereal flavour.   Lovely drop of hop on the finish.  Its pretty intense and pretty lovely to be honest.  Very  good.  Tasty as hell
500ml bottle.  Pours bright orange with a large head.  Aroma is bready lager malt.  Taste has bread, lager malt.  Crisp finish.  Refreshing.

Bottle from Stirchley Wines. Lucozade orange, with a fleshy white froth top. Smells malty. Taste is tangy and crisp. Malt and dry lagery tang, with an edge of winey crispness. Really enjoyed this - easy to drink and tasty.
Bronze with a small head  Low carbonation. Very assertive flaviours especially for its relatively low strength. Its flaviur bullies you into drinking more. Not a run of thr mill beer.

50cl bottle. Pours golden with a nice thin lace head and nice gentle bubbles. The nose has flowers, moss, pine and general notes of being in a forest. The taste has soggy malt and a creamy floral note that goes to the end. The palate is great - medium bodied and textured with a lovely elegant falling away finish. Overall, I like this a lot - great start, beginning and end.

Sörspecialista, Budapest. Áttetsző, mély arany színe van, közepes méretű, gyorsan elpezsgő hófehér habbal. Illata remek: füves, gyantás komlós. Ízében is egyből letaglóz a komlós keserűség, nem olyan szúrósan gej, mint a legtöbb Märzen, sőt! Sok pale ale-t megszégyenítően keserű, édeskés gabonás, kenyeres íz inkább csak az utóízében érződik, de ott már teljesen ki van száradva a teljes belső szájszerkezet. Közepes testű, élénken szénsavas, nagyon száraz és keserű főzet. A Sankt Georgen egyik söre sem okozott még csalódást, de ez különösen jó!

bottle from biershop-bayern.de. Deep golden colour, large and creamy head. Malty nose. Full-bodied, intensive and robust grainy malt flavours dominate, towards the finish there is lots and lots of fresh resiny hops tuning in. Lovely palate, very smoooth and velvety. A delicious Festbier with an impressive hoppy character.

Sörspecialista, Budapest
Világos sárgaréz színe van, ami kristálytisztán csillog a poharunkban. Habja hófehér, apró buborékokkal teli, közepes nagyságú, kemény és kitartó. Illata könnyed, malátás, kissé karamellízalt méz is kiérződik belőle és némi vizes szalma. Íze friss, szinte ropogós, keserű mandula, hársméz, maláta és egy rendes adag komló, kesernyés gyógyfüvek. Nem túl testes, igen szénsavas. Utóíze enyhén gyümölcsös, kesernyés és igen száraz, hosszan tartó. Nagyon frissítő és kellemes márciusi sör, ami könnyen csúszik egy jó társaságban.

0,5 l bottle, Sörspecialista.hu
Poured clear deep golden with a small froathy white head that diminishes to a lacing one. Sourish zeast in the nose with a bready malt and some caramel, herbal-flowery hops with a bit of honey. Medium bodied one with yeast, honey and the malt, some cookies, floral-herbal hops in the finish. Some fruity tastes in the aftertaste.

Bottle from Sörspecialista, Bp.
Deep golden colour with a frothy white head, which collapses slowly and remains finger thick.
Sweet-sourish, fruity smell.
Slick mouthfeeled brew wih a malty start followed in the middle by bread, citrus, grass and dough. Flavours like grapes.
Long and bitter finish with citrus and herbals, which drains the palate and leaves a bready aftertaste behind.
Fine and easy drinkable one.

Bottiglia 50cl al Halley Bar di via San Vincenzo, eccezionale scoperta con bottiglie tedesche di St.Georgen, Spezial, e vari produttori interessanti; questa è una birra molto fragrante, trionfo del malto, tuttavia piuttosto beverina, il luppolo cè e si sente, calorosa, niente sentore metallico, una marzen da amarzen.
Draught at Annafest09. OK malty flavour. Hazy dark golden colour, it seems in the mug. Small semi-stable tan head. Malty flavour, a bit of paper. Semi-sweet. Not bad.
Ceramic mug.  Big medicinal hop aroma. Herbal, hoppy character (it is St. Georgen after all) with light malt backdrop.  Dry, hoppy finish.  Slight malt toastiness adds a "fest" accent.

Tap at Annafest Im krug. Light minrally clementine aroma, a bit grass. Brilliant
composition: fruit minerals, German hop cover. Citrusfruit aftertaste balancing perfectly with hop bitterness - beautifull!

Draft @ Annafest. Iin krug, has a head that lasts through a whole mass! Hoppy aroma is minerals, chlorophyll, stones, earth. Smooth quaffable session beer. Yummy hop juice, very similar in character to their kellerbier.
The bottle looks simple, but good. The beer in the glass also. Starts spicy and sweet, turns then strong, a bit woody, oily, still very spicy. Round finish - good beer!
Bottled. Clear golden color, big frothy white head. Aroma of clean hop, pilsner malt, bit flowery, typical german. Nice bitter taste, bit flowery. Good german beer.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Another Annafest-brew and again a good one. Copper coloured beer with some fruity taste.
Golden color. Mango in the aroma. Flowery, earthy hopflavor with some distant trpical fruit. Earthy bitter finish with mango. Good!

Dark gold beer; collapsing medium off-white head. Grass, malt with also some darker coloured malts, malt-syrup-like. Very nice, hoppy taste, near American hops: slightly citrussy, or vineleaf flavours. Upon a good malty base, but I seem to get some rice-like flavour. Cant be no (joke!)? Alcohol somewhere retronasal. Certain grist slickness, nice medium body, light alcoholwarming. I love this  hoppiness - remarkably close to some American hops, terribly difficult with German ones. Its even better on draught, I know...
Tap. Golden with no head. Weak aroma. Taste is malty with mild hoppiness. Kinda boring.

Bottle: deep golden coloured, thin lacing head; honey and  "english" hops in the nose; strong sweet-bitter flavour, medium to full bodied; finish starts sweet-malty, becomes very quickly dry and enormous hoppy and resinous towards the end. A devilishly moreish and tasty beer. Top quality by St. Georgen, as usual...........

On draft at In De Wildeman, Amsterdam. Had this one some time ago and forgot to rate it, so this is from memory. Clear golden coloured, dying head. Hoppy aroma, sweet malts in flavour ending in a bitter finish. From what i recall i wasnt very impressed, but ill have to try it again to be sure.

(bottle, a Mitbringsel from pivnizub  thanks !) Clear, deep golden colour with short creamy, slightly off-white head. Dry-ish malty and woody, herbal hoppy aroma. Bittersweet flavour, medium body, soft carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Well balanced slightly toasty, honeyish maltiness and an aromatic woody hoppy note; resinous dry and bitter herbal hoppy finish. Unusual dry and quite bitter Festbier. Very good.
This one was great. Red, no head. Very hoppy and bitter. Some similarity to a IPA. Very refreshing and well-balanced.
